title: "Interpreting the Diversity in Arthurian Texts"
first_phrase: This text explores the different spirits observed in various sagas related to the legend of the Holy Grail. The previous tokens discussed the positive spirit found in the Diu Crône, while other texts portray a negative outcome for the hero. The last 200 tokens focus on the epilogue of the text of Manessier, where Parsifal achieves revenge but later renounces his regal dignity and leads an ascetic life after carrying the Grail, the sword, and the lance. The text also mentions the death of Parsifal and the unknown whereabouts of the three objects.
content: Así, el epílogo del texto de Manessier es que Parsifal lleva a cabo realmente la venganza, pero que luego renuncia a la dignidad real y, tomando consigo el Grial, la espada y la lanza, se retira a llevar vida ascética, o sea, a la misma vida a la que, renunciando a la espada, se había entregado, en Wolfram, el hermano herido del rey del Grial para tratar de remediar, por una vía distinta de la heroica, su dolor y decadencia en el período de interregno y de espera. Muere Parsifal, y tras su muerte nadie sabe ya nada de los tres objetos: espada, copa y lanza. De la misma forma, en el Perceval li Gallois, Parsifal 80
last_phrase: In conclusion, Manessier's text highlights Parsifal's ultimate revenge, followed by his renunciation of royal dignity to lead an ascetic life. With the symbols of sword, grail, and lance, Parsifal brings an end to the era of interregnum, but after his death, these objects become lost to history.
